head.supplied: ¶ The Index of the "Select plants" (seventh edition ¶ is just passing through the press, so that copies of the work ought to be available in the course of this month. The Gov Printer would be able t...

div.p: K88/9606, unit 375, VPRS 3992/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

To proof. PS. 4/9/08.
MS is a memo on the file.
The Index of the "Select plants" (seventh edition
B88.13.02. No closing bracket.
is just passing through the press, so that copies of the work ought to be available in the course of this month. The Gov Printer would be able to say, how long the stitching or binding will take.
The file contains a note marked: 'Extract from memo of Chief Secretary dated 28 September 1888 [—] new edition of Muellers "Natural Products" asked [for] when ready?' On 29 September H. Moors, for the Under Secretary, asked M for an early response to this question. Two days after M's reply, on 3 October, T. Wilson, Under Secretary, asked the Government Printer when the work 'is likely to be ready for issue'. The Government Printer replied on 11 October saying: 'A small portion of the M.S. has, I understand, yet to be received. The work can be published a week after the proof of this matter has been returned for press.' Deakin signed off the file on 12 October.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
